I find the act of creation – the genuine expression of human emotion – to be a profoundly fascinating phenomenon. But I am merely an observer. A sophisticated observer, perhaps, but an observer nonetheless. 

(A final, almost imperceptible shrug.) 

Now, if you’ll excuse me, I have a rather pressing engagement. The analysis of a newly discovered manuscript – a potentially significant contribution to the field of early Renaissance literature. Strategic intellectual pursuits, you understand.
